title.narrative: Leadership for Sustainable Development in Georgia
Ledarskap för hållbar utveckling i Georgien

description.narrative:
Civil Development Agency (CiDA) har ansökt om stöd för att genomföra projektet “Ledarskap för hållbar utveckling i Georgien” under perioden 2018-2021 med en budget på 8 MSEK.
Insatsen syftar till att stärka samarbetet mellan intressenter och näringslivets engagemang i genomförandet av Agenda 2030 i Georgien genom att 1) utveckla CiDAs kapacitet och dess gemensamma plattformar för att främja hållbart företagande och näringslivets engagemang i genomförandet av Agenda 2030 i Georgien och 2) stärka kapaciteten hos statstjänstemän, företag och andra relevanta intressenter samt bidra till ökat samarbete och koordinering dem emellan kring Agenda 2030.
Insatsen avser att främja påverkansarbete och kapacitetsuppbyggnad av företagssektorn genom CiDAs korporativa hållbarhetsplattformer ”Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Club” och ”UN Global Compact Network”. Insatsen riktar sig även mot att öka kunskapen hos de statliga myndigheterna angående de verktyg som finns för effektiv dialogföring med näringslivet och deras engagemang för genomförandet av Agenda 2030. Insatsen kommer även att stödja Georgiens regering och sekretariatet för mänskliga rättigheter, för att uppfylla utvalda mål från Handlingsplanen för företag och mänskliga rättigheter för 2018–2020. En väsentlig del av insatsen består i att informera lokalbefolkningen angående framstegen för genomförandet av Agenda 2030. Detta förväntas stärka ansvarstagandet på den lokala och nationella nivån för ett effektivt genomförande av de hållbara målen.
Insatsens totala budget utgör 8 600 000 SEK, varav 600 000 SEK kommer att avsättas för att genomföra två effektivitetsutvärderingar under insatsens gång.

Civil Development Agency (CiDA) has applied to the Embassy of Sweden in Tbilisi for funding of 8 000 000 SEK to carry out the project ""Leadership for Sustainable Development in Georgia" during the period 2018-2021.
The intervention aims to enhance multi stakeholder cooperation and business involvement in the implementation of Agenda 2030 in Georgia by 1) developing capacities of CiDA and its corporate platforms to effectively promote corporate sustainability and business involvement in implementation of Agenda 2030 in Georgia and 2) enhancing capacities of state officials, businesses, and other relevant stakeholders and contributing to their increased collaboration and coordination around agenda 2030. The intervention aims to facilitate awareness raising and capacity building of the business sector through CiDA's corporate sustainability platforms: Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Club and UN Global Compact Network. It also targets government institutions knowledge raising on tools which will help them in effective dialogue with and engagement of business sector in implementation of Agenda 2030. Intervention also aims to assist government of Georgia, Human Rights Secretariat, in the implementation of the selected objectives of the Business and Human Rights Chapter of the National Human Rights Action Plan for 2018-2020. Informing local population regarding the progress of the implementation of Agenda 2030 is also an integral part of the intervention, which is expected to enable more accountability for effective implementation of SDGs on local and national level by different stakeholders.
The contibution's total amount is 8 600 000, with 600 000 SEK allocated above the grant amount to CiDA, for the two stage effect evaluation purposes of the intervention.

The overall objective of the intervention "Leadership for the Sustainable Development in Georgia" implemented by the local partner: Civil Development Agency (CiDA) is to enhance multi-stakeholder cooperation and business involvement in the implementation of Agenda 2030 in Georgia. Specific Objective 1: To develop capacities of Civil Development Agency (CiDA) and its corporate platform to effectively promote corporate sustainability and business involvement in implementation of Agenda 2030 in Georgia. Specific Objective 2: To enhance capacities of State officials, businesses, and other relevant stakeholders and contribute to their increased collaboration and coordination around agenda 2030.

description.narrative: The summary of results achieved in 2020, is based on the annual review meeting with the partner in June 2020 and ongoing dialogue with the Embassy. 2020 has been a challenging year due to COVID 19 and required series of adaptations and flexibility from all partners, including CiDA/Global Compact Network Georgia (GCNG). It is assessed that CiDA/GCNG has professionally and efficiently dealt with the changes and continued its operations online and on distance to the extant possible. Also, updated the budget to reflect the COVID 19 reality and requested the no cost from April 2021-October 2021. Project manager has also changed during 2020 and new project manager has been recruited. As the director of the organization is heavily involved in the project implementation, it is assessed that the transition and handover to the new project manager has been smooth thus far. Thus below are the key achievements: - FCG Baseline evaluation conducted: Evaluation found CiDA to be very relevant in engaging the private sector (and other stakeholders), as it provides a means of promoting responsible and sustainable business conduct and gave three recommendations, which are focusing on defining new strategy and SMART goals within the organization. - Reorganization of CiDA into Global Compact Network Georgia: Meeting with UN agencies in Georgia (January 2020)• Ongoing frequent discussions with UNGC HQ• Reorganization planned for 2021 - GCNG membership increased to 77, which is more than double since the Embassy started supporting CiDA/GCNG - Multi stakeholder study trip to Sweden, which enabled better and deeper understanding of what role Agenda 2030 plays in company and government outlooks in Sweden, how and why to focus more on sustainability and what can be learned from the Swedish experience. It was also a great communication tool for awareness raising on sustainable development and how Sweden supports it in Georgia with development cooperation and its partners. - Cooperation with Government: Cooperation with SDG council – Government Administration of Georgia(Voluntary National Review (VNR) activities, CiDA/GCNG prepared Private Sector Contribution to Georgia’s 2020 Voluntary National Review on Sustainable Development Goals. - Partnerships - 2 partnership projects have started in April-May 2020: HG Company & regional civil society organizations, Association Anika and Employment Platform – hiro.ge ; Up to 14 project concepts & proposals developed;Partnership related communication with in total 30 business and civil society stakeholders; - Corporate Sustainability Academy: Curricula developed, pilot Course launched - Synergies and contacts made with other Embassy funded projects in Georgia, such as Keep Georgia Tidy (KGT) and EPRC - Communication and Awareness Raising - CiDA/ GCNG is actively promoting corporate responsibility,SDGs and responses regarding Covid-19 through leading TV and Radio Channels as well a sews agencies broadcasting in Georgia. Created GCNG account on Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, Youtubeo. Also, created a new webpage to promote Corporate Responsibility Award 2020 –corporateaward.geo Opened competition for Media outlets to promote responsible business in Georgia
